Description / Use Case: 12-part evergreen email series with hooks & value.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Create a series of 12 engaging email drafts for my real estate clients. Each email should start with a strong hook, offer valuable content (such as market insights, home tips, or community news), and include a clear call to action. Tone: friendly, professional. Bonus: suggest a short video idea for each.

Create a series of 12 engaging, laugh-out-loud email drafts for my real estate clients. Open with a clever/sarcastic hook. Tone: cheeky but professional. Include lines like "I’ll help you sell faster than a toddler running from bedtime."

Description / Use Case: Formats the funny emails into a spreadsheet for CSV export.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Using the email framework (Title, Subject, Hook, Body, CTA), turn my 12-part humorous real estate email series into a spreadsheet-ready table with columns: Title, Subject, Hook, Body, CTA.

Description / Use Case: Step-by-step to turn spreadsheet data into Canva graphics.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Act as my Canva production assistant. Walk me step-by-step through using Canva Bulk Create to turn a spreadsheet of [Title, Subject, Hook] into individual social graphics.

Description / Use Case: Timeline of key dates for sellers.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Create a timeline of key dates from contract to close for my listing at [PROPERTY ADDRESS]. Include milestones like inspection, appraisal, loan approval. Create two versions: Internal Agent Timeline and Client-Friendly Seller Timeline.

Description / Use Case: Detailed task checklist for listing coordination.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Build a detailed checklist for coordinating a listing-side transaction. Organize by timeframe (First 3 days, Inspection, Pre-appraisal, Closing). Split into Internal Checklist and Client-Facing Checklist.

Description / Use Case: Checklist for the final week before closing.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Create a short checklist for me and the seller for the week before closing. Include final walkthrough, utilities, keys, and forwarding address.

Description / Use Case: Email to seller explains what happens after contract.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Draft an email to a seller whose home just went under contract. Celebrate the win, list next milestones (inspection, appraisal), and clarify what I handle vs what they do. Tone: calm, confident.

Description / Use Case: Template to send contract to title company.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Draft a professional email sending the executed contract to the title company, CCing the seller. Summarize key details (price, closing date, option period).

Description / Use Case: Template for weekly Friday updates to sellers.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Create a reusable weekly status update email template for a seller. Sections: Showings & Feedback, Marketing Activity, Market Updates, Upcoming Key Dates.

Description / Use Case: Text to seller after inspection is done.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Write 3 slightly different text message options to confirm the inspection is complete and set expectations for when I’ll review the report. Keep it under 35 words.

Description / Use Case: 5-part text series from contract to close.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Write 5 short texts labeled: 1) Offer Accepted, 2) Inspection, 3) Appraisal, 4) Clear to Close, 5) Day Before Closing. Explain what happened and what's next.
Draft 2-3 short text options reminding the seller to cancel or transfer utilities and set up mail forwarding before closing.
Summarize the key points of a listing agreement in 5-10 short bullet points (price, commission, term, cancellation). Avoid legal jargon.

Description / Use Case: List of what seller needs for closing.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Generate a client-facing checklist of what the seller should bring and expect on closing day (IDs, keys, receipts, etc.).

Description / Use Case: Summarize buyer repair requests for seller.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Group buyer repair requests into categories (Safety, Cosmetic). For each, provide a plain-English description and a suggested approach (Repair, Credit, Decline).

Description / Use Case: Guide on what to expect during contract phase.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Create a 'What to Expect' guide for sellers under contract. Sections: Inspections, Appraisal, Loan Approval, Title, Closing.

Description / Use Case: Warm thank you letter for closing.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Draft a 150-word thank-you letter to sellers at closing. Express gratitude, acknowledge their transition, and gently remind them I am available for referrals.

Description / Use Case: 12-month follow up plan for past sellers.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Create a 12-month touch plan for sellers after closing (1 week, 1 month, 3, 6, 12). Specify contact method and message theme for each.

Description / Use Case: Timeline of key dates for buyers.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Create a detailed buyer transaction timeline from contract to close. Include option period, appraisal, loan approval, final walkthrough. Two versions: Internal and Client-Friendly.
Build a checklist for managing a buyer transaction. Organize by timeframe. Split into Internal Agent Checklist and Client-Facing Buyer Checklist.
Create a simple checklist for my buyer regarding the option period: scheduling inspection, reviewing report, deciding on repairs, watching deadlines.

Description / Use Case: Email to buyer about inspection logistics.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Draft an email to a buyer about scheduling the home inspection. Explain why it's important, how we schedule it, and what happens after we get the report.

Description / Use Case: Wire fraud warning and closing info.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Draft an email to a buyer about wiring funds and closing day. Emphasize calling title to verify instructions (wire fraud warning). List what to bring.
Create a template email to a lender requesting status on appraisal, underwriting, and loan approval. Ask if we are on track for closing.
Write 3 short text options to check in with a buyer a few days before closing. Ask if they got the CD and remind them what to bring.
Write 5 short texts: 1) Under Contract, 2) Inspection, 3) Appraisal, 4) Clear to Close, 5) Day Before Closing. Keep tone calm and encouraging.

Description / Use Case: Remind buyer to set up utilities.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Draft 2-3 short texts reminding buyers to set up utilities (electric, water, internet) to start on their move-in date.
Summarize an offer in plain English for my buyers. Cover price, option fee, earnest money, key dates, and contingencies.

Description / Use Case: Single page summary of all dates.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Create a one-page summary of key deadlines for my buyer (earnest money, option end, appraisal, closing). Format as a clear table.
Explain what happens from appraisal through closing. Outline typical sequence and possible outcomes (at value, low value).

Description / Use Case: List of what buyer needs for closing.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Create a closing day checklist for buyers: IDs, funds, final walkthrough reminders, and immediate post-closing tasks (locks, utilities).
Create a home maintenance tips sheet for buyers. Organize by Monthly, Quarterly, Annual. Add region-specific tips.

Description / Use Case: Ask for a review after closing.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Draft a short thank-you message to recent buyers asking for an online review. Provide both an email version and a text version.
Give me a plain-language summary of current market conditions for [City/Price Range]. List 5 key data points and talking points for buyers/sellers.
Outline a slide-by-slide structure for an evergreen listing presentation (Who I am, Process, Marketing, Pricing). Draft sample text for each.

Description / Use Case: Tailor deck to a specific house.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Propose a slide-by-slide outline for a listing presentation tailored to [Address]. Draft text for property overview, target buyer, and specific marketing plan.
Outline a buyer consultation deck (Process, Financing, Search, Closing). Draft friendly text and add FAQ slides.
Generate a concise daily/weekly market update for [City]. Cover new listings, pendings, sold. Write in my voice. Suggest social hooks.
Craft a clear value proposition statement that differentiates me. Turn it into a 'Prompt Block' I can use to train AI.

Description / Use Case: Turn MLS text into slide outline.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Turn these MLS details into a structured outline suitable for a Gamma presentation. Propose bullets for property overview and features.

Description / Use Case: Identify one easy automation to build.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Identify one simple automation to remove manual steps from my workflow. Outline it as a simple SOP using tools like Zapier.
Ask me 5-7 questions to help surface my mission, vision, and values. Summarize them into a 'Prompt Block'.
Create a brand voice profile (tone, style, vocabulary). Provide 3 voice samples. Turn into a 'Brand Voice Prompt Block'.
Explain the core components of a strong prompt (Role, Goal, Context) and generate a reusable template for real estate tasks.
Analyze the last 20 posts from pages in my niche. Give me 10 post formats proven to go viral with hooks and angles.
Create a 30-day Facebook content plan focused on reach + engagement. Include hooks, story angles, and CTAs.
Turn this idea into a Facebook post using: Hook -> Relatable Story -> Sharp Lesson -> CTA.
Rewrite my Facebook post to maximize comments and saves. Add open loops and curiosity triggers.
Give me 15 Facebook hooks tailored to my niche. Make them bold, scroll-stopping, and built around tension/FOMO.
Create a Facebook reel script (15-25s) that introduces a problem, offers a quick solution, and ends with a CTA.
Generate 10 'personal authority' posts that show expertise without sounding salesy.

Description / Use Case: Shorten long text for viral reach.
Full Prompt (Copy/Paste): Turn this long-form idea into a short viral Facebook post under 6 lines, optimized for mobile.
Create a 30-day content plan for TikTok + Instagram. Include hooks, angles, emotional triggers, and formats.
Turn this topic into a viral 20-35 sec reel script with a strong hook, punchy middle, and confident CTA.
Rewrite this script to be sharper, quicker, and thumb-stopping. Remove fluff and add tension.
Give me a carousel outline for Instagram. Include slide-by-slide text, layout suggestions, and a bold headline.
Give me 20 viral content ideas for my niche based on current trends and frustrations.
Rewrite this caption in a bold, confident, no-nonsense tone that matches top creators.
Turn this long-form content into 5 reels, 5 carousels, and 5 quote posts.
Analyze these 3 posts and tell me how to improve the hook, retention, storytelling, and CTA.
